GeneralInformation.School Vision: Every WRS Student is Worthy, Resilient and Selfless
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Nurturing Self-Directed, Confident and Caring Learners
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: We believe that each student is unique and whose potential can be maximised so as to contribute selflessly to society. In line with its culture of learning, the school focusses on holistic, values-driven, student development programmes to engage the hearts and minds of its learners. The school is committed to providing its students with a safe and conducive learning environment to pursue their interests and strive for excellence. Staff and students are encouraged to live out the school motto: Work hard and smart, Rise to every challenge, Serve the school and community.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Community & Youth Leadership: Student Leadership Development through Involvement in the Community Programme

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Character and Citizenship Education is the common thread that binds both the core and co-curriculum programmes in WRS.  The school's Applied Learning Programme - Robotics Education - ensures that every student is put through a Robotics-infused Design & Technology curriculum at lower secondary. Robotics Education instils in students a curiosity to learn through experimentation, questioning, problem-solving and risk-taking. It provides integration of learning across disciplines which include Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM), and develops in students the ability to make connections with real-life problems. As an extension of their learning and to provide our students early exposure to possible post-secondary courses of study and future work opportunities, the school will be offering an ITE-Applied Subject Mobile Robotics to our Secondary 3NT students in 2017. A Drama-in-Curriculum programme is introduced for lower secondary students to develop oracy and self-confidence through creative expression of their ideas and imagination. One special feature in the co-curriculum is Outdoor Education. Secondary 2 students attend a CCE camp during which they are given opportunities to demonstrate their understanding of the six NE messages and hone their social emotional competencies. Secondary 3 students learn more about resilience during a four-day camp by Outward Bound Singapore on Pulau Ubin. The school's Learning for Life Programme - Student Leadership Development through Involvement in the Community - aims to instil in students the purpose of caring for and leading others in the community through their involvement in community outreach activities. By working with partners, both locally and overseas, the programme is designed to help students better appreciate what they have and live out the school values of 'Responsibility, Respect & Resilience' and motto 'Serve the School and Community'.
